The style of a doctor's dress, his equipage, his furniture, weigh not one jot with God. He says, "He that will come after Me, let Him deny Himself, and take up the cross, and follow Me." The physicians who unite with the work of God are to cooperate with God as His appointed instrumentalities; they are to give all their power and efficiency to magnifying the work of God's commandment-keeping people. But physicians have been led to suppose that their capabilities were their own individual property, and they have used the powers given them to do God's work in branching out into 


                                     -251- 

lines of work to which God has not appointed them.
